tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V2.1.9 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Jorge Prado: Feet in the Dirt
programme.sub-title: The rise of a motocross prodigy
programme.desc: Get to know the story behind young Spanish motocross rider Jorge Prado. Get to know the story behind young Spanish motocross prodigy Jorge Prado. The 2018 MX2 world champion has been on a bike since the age of three and hopes to rise to the very top of the sport with the Red Bull KTM Factory Racing team.

programme.title: Test driving before Goodwood
programme.desc: 'Mad' Mike Whiddett's Lamborghini Huracán is ready for its big reveal at the Goodwood Festival of Speed. 'Mad' Mike Whiddett's Lamborghini Huracán is finally ready for its big reveal at the Goodwood Festival of Speed, but first he's got to make sure it doesn't get flattened by Kamaz's huge Dakar truck.

programme.title: Method Movie 3
programme.desc: True to the core. Storied snowboard publication Method Magazine returns with the final film of the Method Movie triad, a globetrotting collection of insane snowboarding and good times that, once again, stays a bit weirder than the rest.

programme.title: Cooking at the Catalan Grand Prix
programme.desc: Host Vanessa Guerra is in Barcelona for Catalan GP, chatting with drivers on the track and in the kitchen. In Barcelona for the Catalan GP Vanessa Guerra challenges Pol Espargaró and Johann Zarco to a cooking challenge, then heads to the track to chat with drivers, and Marc Márquez show us his new livery.

programme.title: The Resilient
programme.desc: The chasing of a dream is fraught with failure, but those who achieve greatness approach failure differently. Those who can weather the many defeats on the road to success are the ones who ultimately achieve their dreams. Craig Venter, the man who mapped the human genome, and skateboard pioneer Stacy Peralta show how they persisted in the face of failure.

programme.title: Surfers' Blood
programme.desc: A film by Patrick Trefz. Renowned surf photographer and filmmaker Patrick Trefz explores the essence of the sport he loves by profiling those who inspire him. From Basque Country, Spain, to Silicon Valley, USA, these unique people are united by a deep connection to the sea.

programme.title: Arriving in Moscow
programme.desc: The b-boys arrive in Moscow for the BC One finals. After exploring the city, they meet Rakaa, the event emcee. The b-boys arrive in Moscow and immediately take off for a photo shoot. After exploring the city, all three are greeted by Rakaa, the event emcee who announces the battles. Now there's nothing left to do but wait for the competition to begin.

programme.title: Barefoot skiing
programme.desc: Jamie O'Brien and the crew are still in Waco, Texas, trying out some new water sports. Jamie O'Brien and the crew are still in Waco, Texas, catching barrels at the new wave pool then hit the cable park and take on some jumps with wompers, skis and more. Then they try their hands–or feet–at barefoot skiing.

programme.title: King Lines: Part I
programme.desc: Champion climber Chris Sharma starts a quest to make first ascents of the greatest unclimbed walls on Earth. Chris Sharma, the world’s strongest climber, embarks on a quest to make first ascents of Earth's greatest unclimbed walls. On his journey, he finds a massive arch rising out of the Mediterranean Sea that could be the most difficult ascent ever.

programme.title: Roraima
programme.desc: A trio of climbers launch an expedition to Mount Roraima, a South American peak shrouded in legend. Climbing partners Kurt Albert and Holger Heuber don't know what they're in for when they join competitive climbing superstar Stefan Glowacz for an expedition to Mount Roraima, a steep-walled South American peak shrouded in both rainforest and legend.

programme.title: The Signal Hill Speed Run
programme.desc: The contest that established downhill skateboarding was a festival of speed, partying and danger. A ridiculously steep hill in California was the stage for downhill skateboarding's first contest and it quickly became the epicentre of the absurd new sport. The Signal Hill Speed Run was a festival of innovation, speed and danger.

programme.title: Seabase 1910
programme.sub-title: Riding the Pyrenees on a fixed-gear bike
programme.desc: Patrick Seabase recreates the gruelling first mountain stage of the 1910 Tour de France on a fixed-gear bike. Recreating the gruelling first mountain stage of the 1910 Tour de France, Patrick Seabase strives for the seemingly impossible: in a single day, he aims to ride five summits, 309km and 7,611m altitude on a fixed-gear bike with no brakes.

programme.title: The Battle of Cape Fear
programme.desc: The world's elite big wave surfers gather to tackle the fierce waves at the daunting Cape Fear event. The world's elite big wave surfers gather to tackle the slabs at Red Bull Cape Fear in Australia, a potentially lethal break. Behind-the-scenes footage reveals just how complicated it is to coordinate a groundbreaking surf competition.

programme.title: Method Movie 3
programme.desc: True to the core. Storied snowboard publication Method Magazine returns with the final film of the Method Movie triad, a globetrotting collection of insane snowboarding and good times that, once again, stays a bit weirder than the rest.

programme.title: Cooking at the Catalan Grand Prix
programme.desc: Host Vanessa Guerra is in Barcelona for Catalan GP, chatting with drivers on the track and in the kitchen. In Barcelona for the Catalan GP Vanessa Guerra challenges Pol Espargaró and Johann Zarco to a cooking challenge, then heads to the track to chat with drivers, and Marc Márquez show us his new livery.

programme.title: The Resilient
programme.desc: The chasing of a dream is fraught with failure, but those who achieve greatness approach failure differently. Those who can weather the many defeats on the road to success are the ones who ultimately achieve their dreams. Craig Venter, the man who mapped the human genome, and skateboard pioneer Stacy Peralta show how they persisted in the face of failure.

programme.title: Surfers' Blood
programme.desc: A film by Patrick Trefz. Renowned surf photographer and filmmaker Patrick Trefz explores the essence of the sport he loves by profiling those who inspire him. From Basque Country, Spain, to Silicon Valley, USA, these unique people are united by a deep connection to the sea.

programme.title: Airbag experiment in Spain
programme.desc: Vanessa Guerra enjoys fun and games behind the scenes in Jerez, Spain, ahead of the Spanish Grand Prix. Vanessa Guerra is in Jerez, Spain to chat with the riders and crews. She discovers what it feels like to deploy a rider's airbag in just 40 milliseconds, as does her special guest, Andrea Dovizioso.

programme.title: Paris
programme.desc: Magician Adam Trent gets a new perspective on a trip to the French capital, taking his magic with him. As a regular visitor to Paris, France, Adam Trent is after a new perspective on this trip. With the help of some locals who sometimes skirt the line of legality, he gets his wish with some rooftop parkour and a journey to the depths of the catacombs.

programme.title: The End of an Era
programme.desc: The arrival of 32-bit systems marked the end of the chiptune era, but opened up new limitless possibilities. The arrival of 32-bit systems removed musical limitations and allowed composers to express exactly what they wanted. While this ended the chiptune era, people around the world recognise the importance and contribution of Japanese 8-bit music.
